results.title: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman
results.brief_description: Michael Connor, Consultant Curator of ‘Screen Worlds: The Story of Film, Television and Digital Culture’, is in conversation with Conrad Bodman, ACMI’s Head of Exhibitions. Connor discusses both the overall concept and the separate sections of the exhibition. Connor and Bodman discuss some of the challenges of choosing, sourcing and exhibiting over a hundred years of creative work and technology relating to the moving image.

results.title: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships

results.brief_description: Looks at the International Fellowship Scheme which operates in Victoria. Highlights the professional development aspects of the project, the influence visiting participants have on school communities and the input gained by schools upon the return of Victorian recipients. Featured speakers include: Rex Murfett, Susan Gianevsky, Richard Wood, Alex McKnight and Kevin Collins.

results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.

results.title: Zvenigora (Musical Soundtrack)
results.brief_description:
Dovzhenko’s most audacious film combines ancient folklore with modern events in ranging over many centuries of Ukrainian history with a political aim of obliquely linking modern revolutionary Ukraine with its distant past. For Dovzhenko the fresco-like narrative was what he described as ‘a catalogue of my creative possibilities’. The four part structure with a strange quest for treasure at its centre, incorporates a series of bracketing devices to enclose such eccentric episodes as those involving a vampire-like monk, midsummer rituals on the river and a toytown battle. Also available on 16mm.

Credits: Director, Alexander Dovzhenko ; writer, Mikhail Johansen, Yuri Yurtik ; photography, Boris Zavelev.
Cast: Mikola Nademsky, Semyon Svashenko, Alexander Podorozhny.

results.title: Zvenigora
results.brief_description: Zvenigora is a complex yet compelling fantasy, presenting the story of a group of Russian peasants and their strong ties with the earth through a series of simple yet strikingly beautiful images. Spanning a period of a thousand years, the film relates the eternal struggle between needing to nurture the land and wanting to strip it of its treasures. A wealth of magical images fill and frame the landscape, from the wizard monk whose death-like countenance terrorises the invaders to the man who advertises his own suicide as theatrical entertainment then absconds with the box office takings. This film is as much a parable about human nature as it is a representation of the struggles of the Russian peasantry, using technical experiments similar to those of Georges Melies to embellish the transcendental nature of the subject. Zvenigora is the fourth film by Russian film master Alexander Dovzhenko, who began his career in film in 1926 after working as both a cartoonist and painter. Despite negative critical reaction to Zvenigora, it was the forerunner of his more celebrated films Arsenal (1929), Zemlya (1930), and Ivan (1932), which perpetuated his interest in honouring the lives and struggles of peasants, and served as a tribute to his heritage as a man of the Ukraine.

results.title: Young Winston
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Carl Foreman, Columbia Pictures and Open Road Films
results.brief_description: This historical drama about British leader Winston Churchill, one of the 20th century’s great public figures, is based on his autobiography “My Early Life”. It chronicles his tumultuous rise to power from childhood to the age of twenty-six, when he delivered his first speech in the House of Commons covering his time as a war correspondent in India, his involvement in Kitchener’s Sudan expedition, and his capture and escape during the Boer War in South Africa. While it glosses over some of the less savory aspects of Churchill’s character, it nevertheless reveals him as a complex and very private man. The cast includes many esteemed British actors such as Robert Shaw, Ian Holm, Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Edward Woodward and John Mills. Churchill’s mother was played by Anne Bancroft.

results.title: You've got mail
results.creator_credit: Nora Ephron, Lauren Shuler and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This story brings romance and courtship (as well as Meg Ryan, Tom Hanks and director Nora Ephron for the third time) into the age of the World Wide Web via email and chat rooms. Joe and Kathleen have a lot in common, they live near each other, they are both in the publishing industry, he in supersized book department stores - Foxbooks, and she in a small independent one - Shop Around the Corner, they even buy coffee at the same place. They have not met in person as yet, but they have met one another in a chat room where they bare their thoughts about life, work and their significant others who are less than perfect. Pretty soon NY152 and Shop Girl want to meet in person, which leads to inevitable angst when two soul mates discover they are business rivals. Cast also includes Parker Posey and Greg Kinnear.

results.title: Year of the Dogs
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia and Michael Cordell
results.brief_description: Football is a game capable of inspiring incredible emotional responses from both players and supporters. Michael Cordell captures the highs and lows of the 1996 season as seen from players and two loyal fans. Key players are followed through their injuries, as are the politics of management. What emerges is a team of players and supporters united by their love for the game and the Footscray Football Club.

results.title: Wyatt Earp
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Kevin Costner, Jim Wilson, Kasdan Pictures and TIG Productions
results.brief_description: Wyatt Earp was one of the most famous lawmen of the american Wild West. With his friend Doc Holliday, Earp and his brothers tried to keep law and order in a land where lawlessness and violence was a way of life. Kevin Costner stars as Wyatt Earp in this epic production and is ably supported by Gene Hackman who plays Earp’s strong-willed father, and Dennis Quaid who is excellent as the sickly but lethal Doc Holliday.

results.title: Woman of the Year
results.creator_credit: George Stevens, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In this sophisticated comedy, the initial venture of that impeccable partnership of Katharine Hepburn and Spencer Tracy, Hepburn plays a renowned columnist and celebrated expert on world affairs. Tracy works on the same newspaper as a sports writer. When Hepburn is nominated “Woman of the Year”, the fight is on between career and marriage.
